intro: Pseudocherleria rhodocalyx, commonly known as the red-leafed pseudocherleria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves that turn reddish in color when mature. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and compact growth habit.
